WorkItem.Description:
I've a file without nothing of special.  It's part of a serie of 4 identical files (they changes only in cell data, internally they are indetical)

But When I create the reader I got

    [error] [php] Undefined offset:  0 (/var/www/... /PHPExcel/Reader/Excel5.php:3245)

Actually I've latest version, I think.

This is the row

    $this->_phpSheet->getColumnDimensionByColumn($i)->setXfIndex($this->_mapCellXfIndex[$xfIndex]);

What does it do ?
And how can I debug and/or workaround this issue?

Comments.Message:
I'm looking to this doc: 

    http://www.openoffice.org/sc/excelfileformat.pdf

At page 146, it speaks about the 2 bytes PHPExcel is trying to read.

> This record also specifies a default XF record (âžœ5.115) to use for cells in the columns that are not described by any cell record (which contain the XF index for that cell).

So, If I omit to set cell default record, what could happen? Probably I'll miss only eventually default column styles. 

But It's a problem of Excel file, not a problem of PHPExcel, right?.
__But what's the right way to handle this kind of defects IN THE LIBRARY?__ 

Please, help, this problem is really blocking my development

This issue is still here in 1.8.0.
Why ?
